title: HSBC Fined $85 Million for Lax Anti-Money-Laundering Controls
sub_head: U.K.-based bank has grappled for years to convince regulators that it can identify fraudulent transactions
body:
HSBC Holdings PLC was fined for inadequate anti-money-laundering controls that the London-based bank used to monitor hundreds of millions of dollars of transactions.
The U.K.’s Financial Conduct Authority fined HSBC £63.9 million, the equivalent of $85 million, for weak oversight at the bank between 2010 and 2018. HSBC didn’t dispute the regulator’s findings, which meant it got a 30% discount on the fine, the FCA said in a statement.
